mobiledoc_revisions.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"‌                                                                                                                                              Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time.Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌As such, MDS volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"‌                                                                                                                                              Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌As such, MDS volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"‌                                                                                                                                              Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such, MDS volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"‌                                                                                                                                              Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such, Maldives Digital Society (MDS) volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"‌                                                                                                                                              Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such, Maldives Digital Society (MDS) volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Key"]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"‌                                                                                                                                              Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such, Maldives Digital Society (MDS) volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Key areas"]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"‌                                                                                                                                              Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such, Maldives Digital Society (MDS) volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Focus areas"]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"‌                                                                                         Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such, Maldives Digital Society (MDS) volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Focus areas"]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"‌                                       Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such, Maldives Digital Society (MDS) volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Focus areas"]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. The intensive training took place on 29 October 2018 in American Centre."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"This training is part of the activity of “empowering women in business”, initiated and implemented by the Women on Board and American Embassy."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The first training sessions by MDS focused on the use of ICT in business, including future technologies and trends. The second training session focused on Online Marketing and the third on Online marketing tools. It was structured into eight training sessions with 60 hours of instruction covering the essentials of Kotlin."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Representatives including Mr Jehad Dradid, Director General of the ICT Department, Dr. Amjad Shehadeh, coordinator of the project from the Ministry of Education and Higher Education (MoEHE), Mr Tap Raj Pant, Head of Education Unit, Ms Sonia Ezam, Senior Programme Officer from UNESCO Ramallah Office, and other colleagues opened the training of teachers and provided overall guidance and direction."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Supported by UNESCO, it was a pioneering experience for the MoEHE to organize such training on mobile apps development for teachers in Palestine. All the trained teachers have received a certificate after successful completion of the training course. With substantial knowledge, skills and hands-on experience gained from the training, the teachers are capable to contribute to the training of students within their respective school communities."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Capitalizing on the achievements yielded from the training of teachers, the MoEHE and UNESCO are ready to embark on the journey of training 675 students selected from Grade 8 to Grade 12. A launch event will be held on 26 November 2018, with the presence of the Minister of Education and Higher Education of Palestine."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Furthermore, in the presence of all the Directorates, the MoEHE has announced the start of the preparation for the Palestine Exhibition of Mobile Apps, which will showcase the mobile apps developed by the trained students and convene stakeholders to discuss on upscaling the training. Representatives of all Directorates confirmed their commitment and stressed the importance of empowering youth to gain digital and entrepreneurial skills."]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. The intensive training took place on 29 October 2018 in American Centre."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"This training is part of the activity of “empowering women in business”, initiated and implemented by the Women on Board and American Embassy."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The first training sessions by MDS focused on the use of ICT in business, including future technologies and trends. The second training session focused on Online Marketing and the third on Online marketing tools. It was structured into 3 training sessions with 60 hours of instruction covering the essentials of Kotlin."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Representatives including Mr Jehad Dradid, Director General of the ICT Department, Dr. Amjad Shehadeh, coordinator of the project from the Ministry of Education and Higher Education (MoEHE), Mr Tap Raj Pant, Head of Education Unit, Ms Sonia Ezam, Senior Programme Officer from UNESCO Ramallah Office, and other colleagues opened the training of teachers and provided overall guidance and direction."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Supported by UNESCO, it was a pioneering experience for the MoEHE to organize such training on mobile apps development for teachers in Palestine. All the trained teachers have received a certificate after successful completion of the training course. With substantial knowledge, skills and hands-on experience gained from the training, the teachers are capable to contribute to the training of students within their respective school communities."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Capitalizing on the achievements yielded from the training of teachers, the MoEHE and UNESCO are ready to embark on the journey of training 675 students selected from Grade 8 to Grade 12. A launch event will be held on 26 November 2018, with the presence of the Minister of Education and Higher Education of Palestine."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Furthermore, in the presence of all the Directorates, the MoEHE has announced the start of the preparation for the Palestine Exhibition of Mobile Apps, which will showcase the mobile apps developed by the trained students and convene stakeholders to discuss on upscaling the training. Representatives of all Directorates confirmed their commitment and stressed the importance of empowering youth to gain digital and entrepreneurial skills."]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. With substantial knowledge, skills and hands-on experience gained from the training, the teachers are capable to contribute to the training of students within their respective school communities."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Capitalizing on the achievements yielded from the training of teachers, the MoEHE and UNESCO are ready to embark on the journey of training 675 students selected from Grade 8 to Grade 12. A launch event will be held on 26 November 2018, with the presence of the Minister of Education and Higher Education of Palestine."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Furthermore, in the presence of all the Directorates, the MoEHE has announced the start of the preparation for the Palestine Exhibition of Mobile Apps, which will showcase the mobile apps developed by the trained students and convene stakeholders to discuss on upscaling the training. {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. It was structured into 3 training sessions of a total of 2 hours."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Representatives including Mr Jehad Dradid, Director General of the ICT Department, Dr. Amjad Shehadeh, coordinator of the project from the Ministry of Education and Higher Education (MoEHE), Mr Tap Raj Pant, Head of Education Unit, Ms Sonia Ezam, Senior Programme Officer from UNESCO Ramallah Office, and other colleagues opened the training of teachers and provided overall guidance and direction."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Supported by UNESCO, it was a pioneering experience for the MoEHE to organize such training on mobile apps development for teachers in Palestine. A launch event will be held on 26 November 2018, with the presence of the Minister of Education and Higher Education of Palestine."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Furthermore, in the presence of all the Directorates, the MoEHE has announced the start of the preparation for the Palestine Exhibition of Mobile Apps, which will showcase the mobile apps developed by the trained students and convene stakeholders to discuss on upscaling the training. {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. The intensive training took place on 29 October 2018 in American Centre."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"This training is part of the activity of “empowering women in business”, initiated and implemented by the Women on Board and American Embassy."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The first training sessions by MDS focused on the use of ICT in business, including future technologies and trends. The second training session focused on Online Marketing and the third on Online marketing tools. It was structured into 3 training sessions of a total of 2 hours."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Representatives including Mr Jehad Dradid, Director General of the ICT Department, Dr. Amjad Shehadeh, coordinator of the project from the Ministry of Education and Higher Education (MoEHE), Mr Tap."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Supported by UNESCO, it was a pioneering experience for the MoEHE to organize such training on mobile apps development for teachers in Palestine. All the trained teachers have received a certificate after successful completion of the training course. With substantial knowledge, skills and hands-on experience gained from the training, the teachers are capable to contribute to the training of students within their respective school communities."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Capitalizing on the achievements yielded from the training of teachers, the MoEHE and UNESCO are ready to embark on the journey of training 675 students selected from Grade 8 to Grade 12. A launch event will be held on 26 November 2018, with the presence of the Minister of Education and Higher Education of Palestine."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Furthermore, in the presence of all the Directorates, the MoEHE has announced the start of the preparation for the Palestine Exhibition of Mobile Apps, which will showcase the mobile apps developed by the trained students and convene stakeholders to discuss on upscaling the training. Representatives of all Directorates confirmed their commitment and stressed the importance of empowering youth to gain digital and entrepreneurial skills."]]]]}

{"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. posts.title: About MDS
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such, Maldives Digital Society (MDS) volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Focus areas"]]],[3,"ol",[[[0,[],0,"People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making"]],[[0,[],0,"Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data"]],[[0,[],0,"Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives"]],[[0,[],0,"Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life"]],[[0,[],0,"Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy"]],[[0,[],0,"Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands"]],[[0,[],0,"Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms"]]]]]}
posts.html:
Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time. Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such, Maldives Digital Society (MDS) volunteers to create awareness that would facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society.

Focus areas

  1. People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and decision-making
  2. Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of data
  3. Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives
  4. Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in all stages of life
  5. Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy
  6. Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands
  7. Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms
posts.plaintext:
Digitalisation is without a doubt one of the biggest challenges of our time.
Instrumental in shaping a better digital society for all involves a deep
understanding of the technological drivers of digitalisation. Digitalisation
affects the key pillars of our societies: notably health, education, work and
island life. A digital society requires robust protection of data, people and
human values. What connects these pillars is the development of knowledge and
understanding of the issues and technologies, in which interdisciplinary
perceptions and methods become the norm instead of the exception.‌‌ As such,
Maldives Digital Society (MDS) volunteers to create awareness that would
facilitate to create conditions, principles and technology to take on this
digital challenge and ensure it will be beneficial for our society.

Focus areas

 1. People & Democracy: create awareness to reinvent trust, dialogue and
    decision-making
 2. Responsible Data: create awareness to enable full and responsible use of
    data
 3. Health : create awareness to let technology generate longer, healthier lives
 4. Education: create awareness to enable people to participate meaningfully in
    all stages of life
 5. Work: create awareness to prepare companies and workers for a new economy
 6. Digital Communities: create awareness to build smart, enjoyable islands
 7. Safety & Security: create awareness to protect data, people and freedoms

posts.title: Training session by MDS for Business startups on ICT and Online Marketing
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. The intensive training took place on 29 October 2018 in American Centre."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"This training is part of the activity of “empowering women in business”, initiated and implemented by the Women on Board and American Embassy."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The first training sessions by MDS focused on the use of ICT in business, including future technologies and trends. The second training session focused on Online Marketing and the third on Online marketing tools. It was structured into 3 training sessions of a total of 2 hours."]]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Supported by UNESCO, it was a pioneering experience for the MoEHE to organize such training on mobile apps development for teachers in Palestine. All the trained teachers have received a certificate after successful completion of the training course. With substantial knowledge, skills and hands-on experience gained from the training, the teachers are capable to contribute to the training of students within their respective school communities."]]]]}
posts.html:
In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. The intensive training took place on 29 October 2018 in American Centre.

This training is part of the activity of “empowering women in business”, initiated and implemented by the Women on Board and American Embassy.

The first training sessions by MDS focused on the use of ICT in business, including future technologies and trends. The second training session focused on Online Marketing and the third on Online marketing tools. It was structured into 3 training sessions of a total of 2 hours.

Supported by UNESCO, it was a pioneering experience for the MoEHE to organize such training on mobile apps development for teachers in Palestine. All the trained teachers have received a certificate after successful completion of the training course. With substantial knowledge, skills and hands-on experience gained from the training, the teachers are capable to contribute to the training of students within their respective school communities.
posts.plaintext:
In Malè, for 40 business startups, MDS completed 3 training sessions, general
use of ICT in business, online marketing and online marketing tools. The
intensive training took place on 29 October 2018 in American Centre.

This training is part of the activity of “empowering women in business”,
initiated and implemented by the Women on Board and American Embassy.

The first training sessions by MDS focused on the use of ICT in business,
including future technologies and trends. The second training session focused on
Online Marketing and the third on Online marketing tools. It was structured into
3 training sessions of a total of 2 hours.

Supported by UNESCO, it was a pioneering experience for the MoEHE to organize
such training on mobile apps development for teachers in Palestine. All the
trained teachers have received a certificate after successful completion of the
training course. With substantial knowledge, skills and hands-on experience
gained from the training, the teachers are capable to contribute to the training
of students within their respective school communities.
